document.text: WHEN DOES THE CHAOS IN THE CURIE-WEISS MODEL STOP TO PROPAGATE?

under the Gibbs measure. The reason for the non-zero limit is the fact that the distribution of
the corresponding binomial distribution satisfy central limit theorems with different variances, the variance
being strictly larger, which comes from the fact that the spins are positively correlated under the
Gibbs measure. The distance between these normal distributions appears on the right-hand side of (13).

The paper is organized as follows. Our proof relies on local limit theorems for the magnetization
also for the total number of positive spins
. In some regimes those are known. We collect
the corresponding results in Section 2 below. The proofs of these local limit theorems, which we have not
been able to locate in the literature, are given in Section 4. The proof of Theorem 1.1 is given in Section 3,
including the statement of residual dependence. Two auxiliary technical results related to calculations of the
total variation distance are presented in Section 5.
